Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.vtk

Class VTKDataSet

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.vtk.VTKDataSet
public class VTKDataSet extends Object
This class facilitates writing a VTK file. It is assumed the caller has a set of points (each point is a 3-element vector). The caller also supplies a list of VTKCell objects, each of which specifies a vtk cell that includes the cell type (triangle, quad, etc.) and the indices of the points that define the cell. The caller can optionally specify a bunch of attribute data to attach to each point or cell. Given all this information, this class will write the information to an output file in vtk format suitable for viewing with ParaView.

Here a code snippet that writes some data from GeoTessModel to a vtk file:


GeoTessModel model = new GeoTessModel("C:\\Users\\sballar\\git\\geo-tess-java\\resources\\permanent_files\\crust20.geotess");
System.out.println(model);

GeoTessGrid grid = model.getGrid();

ArrayList cells = new ArrayList(10000);
int tessId= 0;
int level = grid.getLastLevel(tessId);
for (int t=grid.getFirstTriangle(tessId, level); t <= grid.getLastTriangle(tessId, level); ++t)
cells.add(new VTKCell(VTKCellType.VTK_TRIANGLE, grid.getTriangleVertexIndexes(t)));

float[][] data = new float[grid.getNVertices()][model.getNAttributes()];
for (int i=0; i<grid.getNVertices(); ++i)
for (int j=0; j<model.getNAttributes(); ++j)
data[i][j] = model.getProfile(i, 0).getDataTop().getFloat(j);

VTKDataSet.write(new File("C:\\Users\\sballar\\Desktop\\deleteme.vtk"), grid.getVertices(), cells,
model.getMetaData().getAttributeNames(), data);

Author:
sballar

  • Method Details

    • write

      public static void write(File outputFile, List<double[]> points, Collection<VTKCell> cells, List<String> attributeNames, List<float[]> attributes) throws IOException
      Write a vtk dataset to an output file.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - name of the file to receive the vtk output
      points - the list of 3-component points to be written to the output file
      cells - a List of VTKCell objects that define the indices of the points that comprise each cell.
      attributeNames - (optional - may be null) the names of the data attributes
      attributes - (optional - may be null) the 2D array of attribute values. If the first dimension is equal to number of points, then attributes are attached to points. If equal to number of cells, then they are attached to the cells. The second dimension must be equal to the number of attributeNames.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • write

      public static void write(File outputFile, double[][] points, VTKCell[] cells, String[] attributeNames, float[][] attributes) throws IOException
      Write a vtk dataset to an output file.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - name of the file to receive the vtk output
      points - the array of 3-component points to be written to the output file
      cells - a List of VTKCell objects that define the indices of the points that comprise each cell.
      attributeNames - (optional - may be null) the names of the data attributes
      attributes - (optional - may be null) the 2D array of attribute values. The first dimension must be equal to the size of the points array. The second dimension must be equal to the number of attributeNames.
      Throws:
      IOException
